subject: AI
title: Consent & Transparency
description: Telling users when and how AI processes their data.

hook.text: Users discover their chat messages are being used to train the AI. They're furious â€” not because it happened, but because no one told them.

buildup.text: Transparency requirements: tell users when they're interacting with AI, what data is collected, how it's used, whether it's used for training, and who has access.

discovery.text: Best practices: clear AI disclosure ('This response was generated by AI'), data usage statements, opt-out mechanisms for training data, and accessible privacy policies written in plain language.

twist.text: Regulations are tightening globally. The EU AI Act requires transparency labels. Waiting for mandates is risky â€” build transparency in now to avoid costly retrofits.

climax.text: Transparent AI builds trust. Users who understand how their data is used are more willing to engage. Secrecy breeds backlash.

punchline.text: Tell users what the AI is doing with their data. Before they have to ask.

quiz.question: Why is transparency about AI data usage important?
options: It has no impact on user trust
Regulations require it and users who understand data usage engage more willingly
Users don't care about data privacy
